message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $180.
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $160. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I understand your offer, Bob, but I'm not quite ready to sell it to you for $160. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $170. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really love the product.
I'm getting closer to what I'm comfortable with, but I was thinking $165 would be a better price for me. Can you meet me at that number?
I'm getting close to accepting your offer, Bob, but I'm not quite ready to give up on a better price. I'm willing to meet you at $172.50. It's a fair price for a unique product like this.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm really not comfortable going above $165. Can we meet at that price?

I understand you're firm on $165, Bob, but I'm not willing to give up just yet. I'll meet you halfway between $172.50 and $165, which is $168.50. It's still a great deal for you, and I think you'll love the product.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm really not comfortable going above $165. Can we meet at that price?

I'm starting to get concerned that we're getting too far apart, Bob. I'm willing to make one last offer: $169. It's the lowest I can go, and I think it's still a great deal for you. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I'm really not willing to go any higher than $165. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to consider other options, including buying from a different seller. Can we meet at $165?
